body: @poonamgoyal080 Why do you need to run `python3 setup.py sdist bdist_wheel` to build `mlflow-1.28.0`? Can you just use `pip install mlflow==1.28.0`?
@harupy If I want to install a minor version for example 1.28.1 or 1.28.2 after changing version in mlflow/version.py file then I have to generate wheel file right?
Looks like a duplicate of https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/7231.
Where did you run `python3 setup.py sdist bdist_wheel`? If you have a repository, please share it.
@harupy I am running `python3 setup.py sdist bdist_wheel` in Dockerfile but tried running in my local also but it is throwing same error.
Please share your mlflow fork repository. We can take a look at it to see what's wrong.
I won't be able to share repository but last release I cloned from mlflow that only I want to use with custom changes on top of it.

> I won't be able to share repository

How can we reproduce the issue? I don't think we can because the issue depends on something you can't share.

> custom changes

I think something is wrong with your custom changes.
My custom changes are nothing apart from the dockerfile I shared in #7231

Which parts of this dockerfile are custom changes?

```Dockerfile
FROM python:3.7

ARG VERSION=
ARG EXPOSE_PORT=5000

WORKDIR /app

ADD . /app

ENV DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive
RUN apt-get update &&
# install prequired modules to support install of mlflow and related components
apt-get install -y default-libmysqlclient-dev build-essential curl openjdk-11-jre-headless
# cmake and protobuf-compiler required for onnx install
cmake protobuf-compiler &&
# install required python packages
pip install -r requirements/dev-requirements.txt --no-cache-dir &&
# install mlflow in editable form
pip install --no-cache-dir -e .

RUN curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_16.x | bash - &&
apt-get update && apt-get install -y nodejs &&
npm install --global yarn &&
cd mlflow/server/js &&
yarn install &&
yarn build

RUN python3 setup.py sdist bdist_wheel
```

`RUN python3 setup.py sdist bdist_wheel`
added this so that wheel file can be generated and anyways I am facing same issue even if I am not building wheel with docker
What does `ADD . /app` add?
It's a folder which I created
Is it a mlflow repository?
you mean for app folder?
The local folder you add by `ADD . /app`.
You modified the mlflow source code, right?
yes, this folder you can ignore it is doing nothing.
Please share the changes you made, otherwise we can't help you.

I didn't made any changes as I mentioned earlier I made change in version and docker file. When I build wheel file without docker in my local and install it in VM then mlflow --version shows same Traceback in green colour but it doesn't stop me to import mlflow. But when I build wheel file using docker file and install it in VM then I am not even able to import mlflow and mlflow --version is also throwing same Traceback.

Same code was working just before latest release.
